list.item: Series I: Economic Theory and its History
Series V: P-WCM Published Material by WCM
Series VI: M Money, The Money Economy, and Economic History
Series VIII: O Anthropology and Psychology
Series X: Wesley Clair Mitchell 1998 Addition

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: American economist, teacher. Professor of economics at Berkeley, 1903-1912, and at Columbia University, 1913-1919 and 1922-1944; a founding faculty member of the New School for Social Research, 1919-1922; and the founder and director of the National Bureau of Economic Research, 1920-1945. In 1912, he married Lucy Sprague, educator and founder of Bank Street College of Education.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Professional correspondence, diaries, unpublished articles, lecture notes, abstracts, and other manuscripts by Mitchell. Subjects include economic theory and its history, business cycles, money, national planing, anthropology and psychology, and published material by Mitchell and others.
AAAS American Association for the Advancement of Science
BASM The Backward Art of Apending Money
BC Business Cycle; (13) denotes 1913 volume, (27) denotes 1927 volume
GPW Gold, Prices, and Wages under the Greenback Standard
HP History of Prices Dirung the War
MUNI Making and Using Index Numbers
NB National Bureau of Economic Research
WHDBC What Happens during Business Cycles

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The following boxes are located off-site: 1-6; 15-49. You will need to request this material from the Rare Book and Manuscript Library at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: 1950 M-50 Widow and heirs of Wesley Clair Mitchell Gift
09/30/1998 M-98-09-30 Diaries & additional papers Connecticut, University of Gift

custodhist.p: Gift of the widow and heirs of Prof. Mitchell, 1950.
Gift of the University of Connecticut, 1998.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Wesley Clair Mitchell Papers; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the collection must be requested from the Curator of Manuscripts/University Archivist, Rare Book and Manuscript Library (RBML). The RBML approves permission to publish that which it physically owns; the responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.
